intro: Alsinopsis uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower alsinopsis, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows from a low, creeping stem and produces a single flower per inflorescence, which is often brightly colored to attract pollinators. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, storing water in its fleshy leaves and flowers that bloom during brief periods of rainfall.
